alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 5:20PM EDT until July 12 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, McCreary, Pulaski and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, Science Hill, Burnside, Elihu, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Bronston, General Burnside S.P., Tateville, Ruth, Quinton, Sloans Valley, Pulaski County Park, Alpine, Grade, Kidder, Frazer, Dabney, Dykes, Nancy and Bent. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
